page.title: 03STOCKHILL FOREST, PRIDDY
page.content: Stockhill forest has been established on land once used for lead mining. The area still has the scars of its earlier use. Today, Stockhill is managed by the Forestry Commission and fir trees are by far the most common tree. The ground is soft and springy and the whole area is a haven for wildlife. Adders can be found in profusion and walkers are advised to be careful. There are a number of water tanks scattered throughout the forest incase water is needed to fight a fire. The forest has become a popular place for walks and at Christmas time many local people buy their Christmas trees from the forest.
